Event.name: Education_teaching
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching. A <fen>Student</fen> comes to learn either about a <fen>Subject</fen>; a <fen>Skill</fen>; a <fen>Precept</fen>; or a <fen>Fact</fen> as a result of instruction by a <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Some of the nouns (schoolmaster, -mistress) in this frame refer to administrative positions and do not take relevant frame elements; these will be moved.
<ex><fex name="tea">Dad</fex> <t>taught</t> <fex name="">me</fex> <fex name="fac">that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens</fex>. </ex>
<ex><fex name="fac">What</fex> <fex name="tea">Our Cat</fex> <t>taught</t> <fex name="stu">Me</fex> <fex name="sub"> About Marketing</fex>!</ex>
<ex>For two years <fex name="tea">she</fex> <t>taught</t> <fex name="stu">me</fex> <fex name="sub">French</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="tea">Mom and Dad</fex> <t>taught</t> <fex name="stu">me</fex> <fex name="pre">not to bullshit</fex>, because it always came back to bite me in the ass, without fail. </ex>
<ex><fex name="tea">A young swiss girl up in a swiss chalet</fex> <t>taught</t> <fex name="stu">me</fex> <fex name="ski">how to yodel</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Young Murdock later met <fex name="tea">a blind martial arts master known as Stick, who</fex> taught him how to use his augmented senses and <t>trained</t> <fex name="stu">him</fex> <fex name="rol">as a fighter</fex>.</ex>
<ex> Maria, <fex name="stu">a woman</fex> <t>studying</t> <fex name="rol">to be a nun</fex> is sent from her convent to be the governess of the seven children of a widowed naval captain </ex>
Frame-Element relations:
Several Frame element relations hold in this frame. There is a core-set {<fen>Material</fen>, <fen>Teacher</fen>} (possibly also including <fen>Institution</fen>); these FE's can fill the subject slot of the teach-type verbs. There is another core-set {<fen>Precept</fen>, <fen>Subject</fen>, <fen>Skill</fen>, <fen>Fact</fen>, <fen>Role</fen>} to do with what is learnt. In addition, the FE <fen>Qualification</fen> may occur with <fen>Subject</fen> and <fen>Role</fen> <ex>My sister is <t>studying</t> <fex name="Qualification">for a maths degree </fex> <fex name="Role"> to be a teacher </fex></ex> <ex>She's <t>studying</t> <fex name="Subject">maths</fex> <fex name="Role">to be a teacher </fex>.</ex>
Phrases expressing <fen>Qualification</fen> also very often include information about the <fen>Subject</fen> (see below), which is to be annotated on the second layer.
<ex>Bill is <t>studying</t> <fex name="Qualification">for a BS in physics/a maths degree</fex>.</ex> <ex>Bill is <t>studying</t> for a BS in <fex name="Subject">physics</fex>/a <fex name="Subject">maths</fex> degree.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Teacher
Arg.definition: <def-root>One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.</def-root>

Arg.name: Student
Arg.definition: <def-root>One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.</def-root>

Arg.name: Institution
Arg.definition: <def-root>An educational establishment, such as a school or college.</def-root>

Arg.name: Subject
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
<ex>She's a <fex name="Subject">French</fex> <t>Teacher</t></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Level
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Level</fen> of a student in his/her education. This is distinct from the goal or qualification towards which a student is working (<fen>Qualification</fen> ). <ex>a <fex name="Level">graduate</fex> <fen>student</fen> </ex> <ex>a <fex name="Level">fourth grade</fex> <fen>student</fen> </ex> The above are both <fen>Level</fen>s, in contrast to: <ex>a <fex name="Qualification">doctoral</fex> <fen>Student</fen> </ex> <ex>an <fex name="Qualification">MA</fex> <fen>Student</fen> </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Qualification
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
<ex>She's <t>Studying</t> <fex name="Qualification">for a Master's degree</fex></ex> <ex>She's an <fex name="Qualification">MA</fex> <t>Student</t></ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>Degree to which event occurs</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Manner of performing an action</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the actor (<fen>Student</fen> or <fen>Teacher</fen> depending on the profiling of particular words) that lets them achieve the instruction or learning they are attempting. </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>Result of an event</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time when the teaching occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.
<!--Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>. --> </def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Skill
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
<ex>Taut with worry, Dad <t>taught</t> us <fex name="ski">how to drive</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Precept
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
<ex>My brother <t>taught</t> me <fex name="pre">not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Fact
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
<ex>When I was two she <t>taught</t> me <fex name="fac">that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Material
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
<ex>All employees have received <fex name="mat">a booklet</fex> <t>INSTRUCTING</t> them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . "</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A role, typically professional or vocational, that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
<ex> When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who <t>trained</t> him <fex name="rol">as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Course
Arg.definition: <def-root>FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Teacher</fen> hopes to bring about by teaching.
<ex>I <t>teach</t> <fex name="Purpose">so that I can see the little light-bulb light up</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: student.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A person who is taught by another, often (at least in British English) at a university or other place of higher education

lexUnit.name: pupil.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who is taught by another, especially a schoolchild.

lexUnit.name: teacher.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A person who teaches in an educational establishment

lexUnit.name: professor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a university academic (in BrE: of the highest rank)

lexUnit.name: tutor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a teacher, typically one who teaches a single pupil or a very small group

lexUnit.name: lecturer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: person who gives lectures, especially as a teacher in higher education.

lexUnit.name: tutee.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a student or pupil of a tutor

lexUnit.name: schoolmaster.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a male teacher in a school.

lexUnit.name: schoolmistress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a female teacher in a school

lexUnit.name: schoolteacher.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who teaches in a school.

lexUnit.name: study.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: acquire knowledge on.

lexUnit.name: tutor.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: act as a tutor to

lexUnit.name: coach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: train or teach as a coach.

lexUnit.name: educate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: train or give information on a particular subject.

lexUnit.name: learn.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: acquire knowledge of or skill in (something) through study or by being taught.

lexUnit.name: school.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: train in a particular skill or activity.

lexUnit.name: train.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: teach a particular skill or type of behaviour through regular practice and instruction.

lexUnit.name: training.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: instruction in a particular skill or field.

lexUnit.name: instruct.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: to teach

lexUnit.name: teach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: impart knowledge to or instruct (someone) in how to do something, especially in a school or as part of a recognized programme

lexUnit.name: instruction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: education.

lexUnit.name: education.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the process of educating or being educated.

lexUnit.name: master.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: acquire complete knowledge or skill in

lexUnit.name: educational.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: of or related to the process of educating

lexUnit.name: graduate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who has been awarded a first academic degree, or (N. Amer.) a high-school diploma.

lexUnit.name: protege.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a student of an expert

lexUnit.name: cram.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: study in an intense fashion, usually because of an imminent exam
